meanings.definition: A metrical unit in poetry consisting of a number of metrical feet.
meanings.sent1: The hypermeter of the poem created a rhythmic flow.
meanings.sent2: The poet used hypermeter to establish the poem's structure.
meanings.sent3: The hypermeter of the poem danced gracefully on the page.
meanings.sent4: Her words moved to the hypermeter like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The hypermeter of the poem echoed through the room, captivating all listeners.

meanings.definition: A metrical pattern in music with a larger number of beats than the standard meter.
meanings.sent1: The composer incorporated hypermeter to add complexity to the music.
meanings.sent2: The hypermeter of the piece gave it a unique rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The hypermeter in the music skipped playfully between notes.
meanings.sent4: The hypermeter of the song was a powerful force driving the melody forward.
meanings.sent5: As the hypermeter changed, the mood of the music shifted dramatically.
